Table.TITLE: A Primer of Anesthesia
Table.Abstract: • Anesthesia is a rapidly expanding and vital specialty and there is an ever-increasing need for trained anesthesiologists to provide safe perioperative care to patients at primary health center (PHC) level to tertiary hospitals carrying out cardiac surgery, neurosurgery and transplantations. • Written with the aim of demystifying anesthesiology and presenting the necessary theory related to pharmacology, equipments and skills in an easy to understand matter. • The text has been divided into four main sections covering the preoperative period, intraoperative period, postoperative period and critical care which deals with all the major aspects of an anesthesiologist’s day-to-day work schedule. • Spiced with original drawings and sketches in sections dealing with monitoring, vascular access, airway management and the figures on fluid therapy. • Focus is on problems and ways to solve them intelligently and answering questions that students want to ask.
Table.authorAf1: Professor Department of Anesthesiology and Intensive Care All India Institute of Medical Sciences New Delhi, India

Table.TITLE: Anaesthesia in Laparoscopic Surgery
Table.Abstract: • A well written and illustrated book with updated information covering all the aspects of anaesthesia, its complications and management in laparoscopic surgery. • The chapters have been clearly thought and updated, and the language of the text is simple and very lucid. • Anesthesia in laparoscopic surgery has been elaborated in great detail and chapters have been written by experts in the field within the department with many years of insight and experience.
Table.authorAf1: Chairperson Dept. of Anaesthesiology, Pain and Perioperative Medicine Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, New Delhi
Table.authorAf2: Senior Consultant Dept. of Anaesthesiology, Pain and Perioperative Medicine Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, New Delhi

Table.TITLE: Applied Geriatric Anesthesia
Table.Abstract: • Contains basic sciences and pathophysiology to include every aspect of geriatric surgery with special reference to anesthetic services. • Helpful to initiate the process of preparing the guidelines for perioperative care of the elderly and enable the practitioners to comprehensively look after their patients adequately and provide them healthy lifespan.
Table.authorAf1: Emeritus Consultant Deptt. of Anesthesiology Pain and Perioperative Medicine Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, New Delhi Formerly, Vice President ISA (National)-2000

Table.TITLE: Clinical Anaesthesia
Table.Abstract: • Written to enable the students to grasp the fundamental knowledge of the subject in a most concise way • Applied aspects are also incorporated in as far as practicable manner • Extensively revised, modified and updated in the light of present knowledge • Primarily meant for undergraduate students and for those appearing in the
Table.authorAf1: Formerly Professor of Anaesthesiology Medical College and Hospitals Kolkata

Table.TITLE: Essentials of Anaesthesiology
Table.Abstract: Extensively revised and updated in the light of present knowledge Provides adequate information about drugs used as anaesthetic agents with their proper dosage and possible effects A useful practical guide book on anaesthetic care with a rational approach to clinical anaesthetic management.
Table.authorAf1: Formerly Professor of Anaesthesiology Medical College and Hospitals Kolkata

Table.TITLE: Manual of Anaesthesia
Table.Abstract: This completely updated practical reference is a comprehensive guide to the anaesthetic and preoperative management of patients during all procedures performed by general and subspecialists The book explains that each procedure needs to be evaluated before performing it whether for anaesthetic purpose or medication Explains the fundamentals of clinical anaesthesia by providing a point-wise discussion on each procedure so that students grasp the subject easily and thoroughly. Explanation of each procedure from the perspective of all concerned to make decisions before, during and after surgery.
Table.authorAf1: Ex-Professor, Dept of Anaesthesiology Medical College and Hospitals Kolkata, India

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Anaesthesia in Obstetrics & Gynaecology
Table.AUTHORNAME: Narendra Malhotra, Jaideep Malhotra, Vinay Tiwari, PL
Table.Abstract: • An absorbing overview of the problems faced on the obstetric floor and their solutions. The obstetricians and patients today, do not seek ‘anaesthesia’ but demand only ‘analgesia’, be able to ambulate and also actively participate in the birthing experience. The use of neuraxial techniques and dugs described in the text, address this new demand. • Contains information on HIV positive parturient, medicolegal issues and practice guidelines of obstetric anaesthesia.
Table.authorAf1: Malhotra Nursing and Maternity Home (P) Ltd 84, MG Road, Agra 282010
Table.authorAf2: Malhotra Nursing and Maternity Home (P) Ltd 84, MG Road, Agra 282010
Table.authorAf3: Consultant Anaesthetist Malhotra Group of Hospitals Agra
Table.authorAf4: Associate Professor, Medical College Ludhiana

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Obstetric Anaesthesia & Analgesia
Table.Abstract: • An up-to-date manual to provide a concise source of information regarding current obstetric anesthesia practice in a straightforward approach. • Covers common disorder and disease during pregnancy, pharmacological aspects, neonatal resuscitation, obstetric complications, etc. • Emphasises the current anaesthetic management and the essential scientific basis of anaesthesia practice in obstetrics in easily understandable manner, but with concise coverage.
Table.authorAf1: Ex-Professor of Anaesthesiology Medical College and Hospitals, Kolkata India

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Regional Anaesthesia
Table.Abstract: • A manual covering every relevant aspect of regional anaesthesia and analgesia particularly with the emphasis on the basic and practical applications. • Attempts to provide a concise source of information in easy-to-understand style, so that conduction blocks can be practised confidently for better patient care. • Incorporates a large number of line drawings and explanatory diagrams to illustrate the commonly used techniques of conduction block including nerve blocks.
Table.authorAf1: Ex-Prof of Anaesthesiology Medical College and Hospitals Kolkata, West Bengal, India

Table.TITLE: Anatomy at a Glance
Table.Abstract: The overall objective of this book is to develop integrated skills in listening, speaking, reading, writing and also to develop interest in anatomy. Designed to help the medical, paramedical, nursing and postgraduate students. The most important part of the book is the appropriate diagrams to help the students in visual impression and long-term memory for exam. An exam oriented textbook written in a simple, lucid and communication style.
Table.authorAf1: Professor of Anatomy Calcutta National Medical College, Kolkata, India IPGME & R (Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research), Kolkata, India Ex Associate Professor of Anatomy North Bengal Medical College, Darjeeling, India Ex Associate Professor of Anatomy Calcutta Medical College, Kolkata, India Ex Associate Professor of Anatomy Nil Ratan Sarkar Medical College, Kolkata, India

Table.TITLE: Basics in Human Anatomy (For B.Sc Paramedical Courses)
Table.AUTHORNAME: Priya Rangnath, Suruchi Singhal, Leelavathy N, et
Table.Abstract: This book contains a simplified version of all systems and it is hoped that this will be understood by all paramedical students. The gross, microscopic and applied anatomical features of each system are given together so that it becomes easy for the students to understands and correlate. The text is simple and the line diagrams are easy to follow to reproduce during the exam. An attempt to present a comprehensive overview of anatomy including a section of general embryology.
Table.authorAf1: Associate Professor, Dept. of Anatomy
Table.authorAf2: Associate Professor, Dept. of Anatomy
Table.authorAf3: Associate Professor, Dept. of Anatomy
Table.authorAf4: Lecturer, Dept. of Anatomy
Table.authorAf5: Professor, Dept. of Anatomy St John’s Medical College Bengaluru India

Table.TITLE: Clinical Anatomy for students: Problem solving approach
Table.Abstract: A unique blend of gross, developmental, radiological and clinical anatomy. Anatomical relations as a basis of symptoms and signs in various body parts¬–head, neck and brain, thorax abdomen and pelvis, upper and lower limbs- have been dealt with very well which makes the book a valuable companion to the clinicians as well as to imaging departments, gives a crisp and lucid account of correlative neuroanatomy. Profusely illustrated with artist drawn and computer process color figures. A comprehension textbook fulfilling the MCI objectives on graduate education with a thrust on problem solving.
Table.authorAf1: Head of the Department of Anatomy Dr SMCSI Medical College Karakonam, Trivandrum

Table.TITLE: Embryology for Medical Students
Table.Abstract: This second edition is the result of overwhelming response to the author’s first edition. The text matter has been thoroughly revised and updated, few diagrams are modified and improved and some new diagrams are added. Includes summary of the text at the end of each chapter for quick revision. Presents lucid and simplified account of developmental process including about 250 illustrative diagrams. The diagrams are simple enough so that the students can reproduce them easily at the time of exams.
Table.authorAf1: Professor and Head Department of Anatomy BJ Medical College Pune, India

Table.TITLE: Gross Anatomy Workbook
Table.Abstract: This revised edition of gross anatomy workbook is the fruitful result of additions, corrections and incorporation of useful suggestion of students and teachers. This workbook presents partially drawn and fully labeled diagrams. Meticulous care has been taken to incorporate only those diagrams which are relevant to the students from exam point of view. Students are supposed to complete a diagrams and color them as per the standard norms of anatomy.
Table.authorAf1: Associate Professor Department of Anatomy Surat Municipal Institute of Medical Education and Research Surat, India

Table.TITLE: Human Anatomy for Students
Table.Abstract: The book is an effort to understand the subject of anatomy in an attractive way. Much importance is given to histology so that everyone can reach into the depth of human anatomy. The language of the book is simple and easy to understand with colourful diagrams. It covers all chapters of anatomy and a lot of uncommon questions with palatable and easily perceived answers. It fulfils the requirements of each and every graduate and postgraduate student of medical sciences in a reliable manner so that they are well acquainted with problems of theoretical, practical and oral exams including dissection, radiology, etc.
Table.authorAf1: Professor of Anatomy DKMMHMC Aurangabad, Maharashtra

Table.TITLE: Textbook of Biochemistry for Dental/Nursing/Pharmacy Students
Table.Abstract: An attempt has been made to present the text point-wise, clinically oriented in simple and lucid language avoiding complicated chemical formulae so that it becomes comprehensive, and an average student of dental and basic sciences can easily understand the subject. Though the main framework of second edition has been retained, extensive revision of certain positions has been made. Topics like ‘protein synthesis’ have been rewritten keeping in view the recent advances. New chapters like ‘Recombinant DNA Technology’ and ‘Biochemistry of AIDS’ have been incorporated.
Table.authorAf1: Formerly

Table.TITLE: Jaypee Gold Standard Mini Atlas Series Histology
Table.Abstract: This small, convenient handy book will be useful for rapid revision of the salient features to be seen in histology slides of various tissues of the body. It includes relevant information on epihelia, gland, tissues, cardiovascular system/respiratory, skin, oral cavity, liver, male/female reproductive organs, eye, ear etc
Table.authorAf1: 52, Sector One Rohtak 124001

Table.TITLE: Jaypee Gold Standard Mini Atlas Series Neck Dissections
Table.Abstract: • Intended to provide the readers with a comprehensive and real life step-by-step scenario in neck surgery. • We all come to encounter the disease in advanced stage where are face resource constraints in investigations and managing the cases. This book is an excellent handbook which has been customized to help counter all the constraints. • The step-by-step reelection of chapters has made the book an easy reading. • The elaborate description of staging, panning and execution of therapeutic modality are based on contemporary surgical principles. • Includes vivid illustrations, booth drawings and pictures taken during operations, will immensely help the postgraduate students and the practicing surgery well. • The atlas includes figures that would cover up all aspects of neck dissections and are live form various surgeries performed by the author over a period of time. • Beneficial for all postgraduate and undergraduate students, general surgeons, head and neck surgeons and practising surgeons with interest in the field of surgical oncology.
Table.authorAf1: Associate Professor of Surgery Vardhman Mahavir Medical College and Safdarjung Hospital, New Delhi India

Table.TITLE: Practical Histology for Medical Students
Table.Abstract: This book consists of two sections dealing with tissues and organs with a provision of space for drawing diagrams which will be helpful in the students’ practical classes. Written in a very simple and lucid language having concise histological aspects of tissues and organs of the body. Useful as a refresher book during their paraclinical and clinical cases. Important slides under light microscope have been covered.
Table.authorAf1: Professor and Head, AN Magadh Medical College Gaya

Table.TITLE: SAQs in Anatomy
Table.Abstract: SAQs are useful in measuring learning outcomes in the lower and middle level cognitive domain, i.e., knowledge comprehension, application and analysis. This book is doubly beneficial as SAQs can be asked in theory exam as well as viva voce during practicals. Highly useful for undergraduates and students preparing for postgraduate entrance exam. About 300 new SAQs (especially clinically oriented) have been added in this edition and a new chapter on SAQs in radiology has been added.
Table.authorAf1: Professor of Anatomy Terna Medical College Nerul, Navi Mumbai Ex-Associate Professor of Anatomy Grant Medical College Mumbai

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Cross Sectional Anatomy
Table.Abstract: This step by step handbook has been designed for each reference for all those involved in performing CT scans. This is the first step guide towards interpretation of CT studies. An easy to use atlas of normal axial CT anatomy containing about 100 high resolution CT images covering all systems of the body. It also contains a CD-Rom of images.
Table.authorAf1: Chief Radiologist Division of Computed Tomography and Body Imaging Department of Imaging Sciences KG Hospital and Postgraduate Institute Coimbatore Programme Director, Radeducation Pvt. Ltd. Coimbatore
Table.authorAf2: Consultant Radiologist GEM Hospital (P) Ltd Coimbatore

Table.TITLE: Textbook of Anatomy Vol1
Table.Abstract: The subject of anatomy is dull and boring but the author has made an attempt to make this book interesting as well as informative. Emphasis has been made on a picture memory rather than a verbal one; and on understanding of facts rather than their cramming. All the three volumes incorporates a color atlas (according to the section) as a guide followed by detailed consideration of individual structures. The atlas is realistic to the extent that normal contours and relationships are maintained in the illustration for medical students. Vol 1 comprises of 4 parts-an elementary introduction to the structure of the Human body, osteology, upper extremity and lower extremity.

Table.TITLE: Textbook of Anatomy Vol2
Table.Abstract: Vol. 2 consists of Two parts- The thorax and the Abdomen and Pelvis.

Table.TITLE: Textbook of Anatomy Vol3
Table.Abstract: Vol. 3 consists of Two parts-head and neck and central nervous system

Table.TITLE: Biochemistry: Instant Notes for Medical Students
Table.Abstract: This book, probably the first of its kind meant for exam going students comes as a much awaited gift to students’ fraternity. It contains 24 chapters in all with question and answers, tables, attraction flow charts, viva questions, illustrative pictures and case reports covering the entire syllabus of medical biochemistry. It will help the learners in easy assimilation and effective recall of information along with easy understanding of biochemical basis of the disease process and basic concepts in metabolism. Will serve as an effective additional aid not only for medical but also for dental, allied health, nursing and pharmacy students to score better in their exams.
Table.authorAf1: Department of Neurochemistry National Institute of Mental Health And Neuro Sciences (NIMHANS) Hosur Road, P.B. No. 2900, Bangalore - 560029, INDIA

Table.TITLE: Clinical Biochemistry
Table.Abstract: The book is primarily intended to meet the requirements of CMLT/DMLT and undergraduate courses. It covers all the required topics in a descriptive and sygnoptic style. Various concepts have been explained using simple language and short sentences for easy comprehension. It also discusses the latest techniques in biochemistry like glucometer, HbA/C test and autoanalysers. The text is divided into 2 parts-first part deals with elementary knowledge of organic, inorganic physical and analytical chemistry. The second part deals with aim and scope of biochemistry, structure of cell, carbohydrates, proteins, lipids enzymes, metabolism, hormones, liver/renal function text (cardiac function test), electrolytes, body fluids, automation, etc.
Table.authorAf1: Institute of Paramedical Sciences Nanded, Maharashtra India

Table.TITLE: Laboratory Manual for Practical Biochemistry
Table.AUTHORNAME: Shivaraja Shankara YM, Ganesh MK, Hemavathi
Table.Abstract: This book fulfills the need for a complete and comprehensive book on orientation towards various aspects of practical biochemistry. A clear-cut practical concept has been presented in respect of all qualitative and quantitative experiments. Chapters on demonstration experiments such as colorimetry, electrophoresis, chromatography etc. are also included. Questions at the end of each chapter and normal values of various biochemical parameters in blood and urine are incorporated. A concise, exam-oriented, knowledge-based laboratory manual for undergraduate students studying biochemistry.
Table.authorAf1: Associate Professor Department of Biochemistry KVG Medical College Sullia, Karnataka
Table.authorAf2: Asst. Professor Dept. of Biochemistry KVG Dental College Sullia, Karnataka
Table.authorAf3: Asst. Professor Dept. of Biochemistry KVG Medical College Sullia, Karnataka

Table.TITLE: Multiple Choice Questions in Biochemistry 2/Ed.
Table.Abstract: This book includes 2,100 MCQs organized into 27 chapters covering core topics in biochemistry as well as the emerging areas. Each chapter has been reviewed by an experienced teacher. Referenced answers have been provided to all the questions. Most of the questions are based on Harper’s biochemistry. Covers the whole subject in an exhaustive and balanced way. Topics like vitamins, minerals diet and nutrition find adequate coverage and rapidly advancing areas like recombinant DNA technology, immunochemistry and cancer have also been discussed. A number of questions have been replaced or substantially revised and about 300 new questions have been added. A new chapter on metabolism of xenobiotics has also been added.
Table.authorAf1: Professor and Head Department of Biochemistry Govt. Medical College Kota (Rajasthan)

Table.TITLE: Clinical Diagnosis of Congenital Heart Disease
Table.Abstract: • Describes all aspects of congenital heart diseases in a uniform pattern. Elaborate description has been made on common diseases. Illustrations with simple hand drawn sketches are given wherever necessary depicting the abnormal anatomy and pathophysiological consequences for clear understanding of the anomaly. • A link between pre-echo era and present day investigatory tools as regards clinical diagnosis is concerned. • Pathophysiology of all diseases is well explained • Characteristic points of electrocardiography and radiography leading to correct clinical diagnosis are well-enlisted

Table.Abstract: • A clinically oriented survey of Cardiology bridges the gap between elaborate texts and very precise hand books. • Written for postgraduate students of general medicine who are required to have a sound knowledge of Cardiology, a common speciality encountered in the exam and while practicing as a physician. • Deals with specific cardiovascular diseases, applied pharmacotherapeutics of important drugs and management procedures.

Table.TITLE: ECG Made Easy
Table.Abstract: The initial chapters are devoted to basic principles, nomenclature of waves and to the calculation of heart rate and electrical axis. This is followed by potential abnormalities of the various deflections and their intervening segments, with due emphasis on causation and clinical relevance. The later section deals with cardiac arrhythmias in which apparently similar rhythms are discussed together in one chapter. This helps to compare their mechanism, causation, recognition and management. ECG Made Easy is meant for those keen to learn electrocardiography from basics to therapeutics in a short time.
Table.authorAf1: Diplomate National Board of Medicine Physician and Cardiologist

Table.TITLE: ECHO Made Easy
Table.Abstract: • Explains the basic principles of ultrasound and Doppler, and the clinical applications of various echo modalities • Discusses various echo features of heart disorders individually such as congenital, valvular, coronary, hypertensive, etc. • Incorporates a new chapter on color Doppler echo, a recent development in echo technique • Includes impressive and striking color illustrations, figures and color-flow maps • Helpful especially to students and teachers of echocardiography as well as practicing clinicians and physicians.

Table.TITLE: A Concise Textbook of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery
Table.Abstract: This book contains a step-by-step, integrated diagnosis and management of maxillofacial surgery. Presents a comprehensive coverage of all of the most current clinical aspects of oral surgery to write answers for the theory examination in full confidence, and face viva voce The unique feature of the book is that instead of reproducing photographs throughout the text, hand-drawn illustrations are used to explain surgical procedures that give a visual description of every step The sketch of the surgical procedures would enable students to understand easily and reproduce the same in examinations taken on concerned topics. It would appeal to students as a quick reference
Table.authorAf1: Lecturer, Dr BR Ambedkar Institute of Dental Sciences and Hospital, Patna, India

Table.TITLE: A Practical Guide to Hospital Dentistry

Table.TITLE: Histology for Dental Students with Clinical Aspects
Table.Abstract: The book presents update and concise account of the complicated yet interesting subject, Histology, for the dental students. It provides a unique pictorial approach to make complexities of tissue structure easier to understand and remember. The most striking attraction of the book is the inclusion of the topics and chapters which are recently incorporated in the DCI curriculum. The language of the text is kept simple and is well suited for a broad range of students including ones having little English background. Color atlas at the beginning of the book featuring good quality photomicrographs elucidates the appearance of various structures more accurately and thus will help the students master the key knowledge in textual presentation. Hand drawn color illustrations which effectively communicate every essential aspect of cell structure and function have been incorporated.

Table.Abstract: This atlas and synopsis of pediatric dermatology, now in its second edition, is an excellent introductory effort well-suited written by Professor Sandipan Dhar of Kolkata (Calcutta) – the book capital of India – a noted pediatric dermatologist who is Chief Editor of the Indian Journal of Dermatology, and Secretary of the Indian Society of Pediatric Dermatology. This book is an attractively bound 170-page hardcover work divided into 20 skillfully authored chapters beginning with neonatal dermatoses. The first edition had been the first pediatric dermatology book from the entire Indian subcontinent. This second edition has been expanded, with three more chapters and 60 additional entries. It contains 400 photographs, all in color, and included common and selected rare dermatomes in the pediatric age group.

Table.TITLE: A Visual Field Evaluation with Automated Devices
Table.Abstract: · Glaucoma is one of the important causes for irreversible blindness all over the world and automated perimetry is the current gold standard to diagnose glaucoma and its management. · The main aim of this book is to make the ophthalmologist to understand the basic fundamentals of automated static perimetry, to select the most appropriate test to the clinical condition he is dealing with, to understand the visual field printouts and to interpret the printouts without much difficulty. This will enable to identify a field defect; to decide whether the field defect is due to glaucoma and to make a reasonable decision whether the defect is progressive one or not. · Offers an excellent approach to automated static perimetry using the Humphrey system. · All the chapters from fundamentals of perimetry to interpretation, visual field loss in glaucoma, follow-up etc. are well covered with necessary visual field printouts. · Moreover, the entire text has been updated, expanded and rearranged for better understanding of the visual field printouts. · All the illustrations have been carefully scrutinized and revised as necessary. Tour chapters have been added which are custom & Follow-up Tests, short Wavelength Automated Perimetery (SWAP) and Freqency doubling Technology (Humphrey FDT-Matrix). · An excellent teaching tool useful to the residents in ophthalmology or the practitioners who want ot learn in an easily understandable fashion about pecimetry.

Table.TITLE: Atlas on Clinical Ophthalmology
Table.Abstract: This book presents the full spectrum of clinical application of ultrasound in diagnosis of abdominal disorders. It gives complete knowledge about the anatomy and sonographic description of abdominal organs Covers all aspects of abdominal ultrasound imaging with chapters on the liver, gallbladder, biliary tract, pancreas, spleen, gastrointestinal and urinary tract, anterior abdominal wall, peritoneum, retroperitoneum, male and female genital systems and ultrasound guided abdominal interventions • An ideal, concise, economical and user-friendly tool for self-assessment in this speciality. It uses more than 650 ultrasound images and relevant Doppler and CT images that describe various aspects of diseases and abnormalities pertaining to the abdomen • It aims to enable the readers to interpret images for precisely correct diagnosis of disorders. Table.TITLE: Foundations in Vitreoretinal Diseases: Diabetic Eye Diseases
Table.Abstract: • This book covers all aspects of diabetic retinopathy in a detailed but understandable manner for the general ophthalmologists and retinal specialists. • The authors have combined their own wealth of experience and included the most recent up-to-date advancements in the field in a single comprehensive volume. • Diabetes is a complex multifactorial disease. Progressive retinopathy is the cause of visual loss in patients with diabetes mellitus though; hearty structures of the eye get affected. This book compiles the current information from leading ophthalmologists and physicians regarding both diabetes and the associate eye diseases. • All information incorporated in the book is based on the evidence collected over years in medical literature. The emphasis has been on elaborating the accepted standard of care.

Table.TITLE: Gonioscopy: A Text and Atlas
Table.Abstract: • Gonioscopy is one of the basic examination techniques in ophthalmology. It provides an insight into the basic pathophysiology of various anterior segment disorders, that affect the anterior chamber angle. • Gonioscopy is a vital tool in the assessment of glaucomatous disorders as it establisher the cause for the obstruction to aqueous flow and gives an idea about the risk of developing glaucoma in the future. It is also used while performing glaucoma laser therapy and incisional treatment in congenital Stan come • This book has been conceived to serve as an office companion for practicing ophthalmologists and residents to train them in the art and science of gonioscopy. • Covers the basic principles of fonioscopy, indications for use, various types of gonioscopes, technique of gonioscopy, normal angle anatomy, special techniques for dynamic fonioscopy and includes various pathological conditions which can alter the anatomy of the anterior chamber angle.
Table.authorAf1: Associate Professor Clinical Ophthalmology Dr Rajendra Prasad Centre for Ophthalmic Sciences All India Institute of Medical Sciences New Delhi

Table.TITLE: Handbook of Optometry and Eye Disorders
Table.Abstract: • This book covers ophthalmic optics, diseases and disorders of the eye to enable and highlight the patients and customers to be aware of their ailments, as today families put health at the top of their concern list. • Provides basic information about structure, anatomy and working system of the eye. • The entire text has been presented in Lucid and simple language for easy understanding. • Contains two parts separated into 8 chapters comprising of eye Anatomy, Principles of Optics: Light and Refraction, Optics and Eye, Errors of Refraction, Anomalies of Refraction, Examination of the Eye: Procedure, Contact Lens, and common eye disorders. • Highly useful for optometrists and opticians.

Table.TITLE: Innovative Techniques in Ophthalmology
Table.AUTHORNAME: Ashok Garg, I Howard Fine, Ioannis G Pallikaris, et
Table.Abstract: • Today, ocular surgeons are facing major changes in their practice and innovative techniques incorporated in this book are not only important but also fostering others in the future that will lead them to a complete transformation in their surgical practice. • The book addresses issues related to microincisional surgical techniques, new intraocular lenses that are capable to suppress or decrease eye aberrations after surgery, new knowledge in applied option that is creating a new environment for cataract surgery. • Another area of interest of this book is glaucoma, which is now being approached not only with new pharmacology but also with new surgery. New approaches made glaucoma surgery to be able to face these cases with an armamentarium that improves their performance and speeds up the surgical process. • Incorporates information about new examination techniques to make a correct diagnosis and to define the best approach to solve an ocular problem.

Table.TITLE: Low Vision Aids
Table.Abstract: • This book has been designed to offer expert information to the eye care practitioners so that they can guide and provide basic low vision care to each patient in their small step up. • A user-friendly book helps to encourage the optometrists and ophthalmologists to recognize the importance of low vision devices enabling the partially-seeing patient to utilize their remaining vision to its full potential. • Contains information to understand the meaning of visual acuity in relation to normal vision low vision and blindness; to identify people with low vision as distinct from those who have normal vision and those who are blind; how distance and near visual acuity is treated in low vision centre; understand the meaning of magnification and its different powers; how to prescribe low vision devices in the correct way, list advantages and disadvantage of each and teach a person with low vision how to use them; understand the importance of rehabilitation and identify those who need it. • Helps in understanding the effect of low vision and describes problems that people with low vision face.

Table.TITLE: Mastering Intraocular Lenses (Principles, Techniques & Innovations)
Table.Abstract: • Today, the aim of cataract surgery and IOL Implantation is the restoration of functional vision, which in practical terms is the ability of an individual to perform his daily living activities comfortably. • Like cataract surgery, Intraocular Lenses (IOLS) have also made rapid strides in the last two decades. From simple IOLS, two decades back, now a wide array of vision correcting IOLS are available commercially for Modern Phaco, Microphacs and Lenticular Refractive Srugery. • This International book on ‘Martening IOLS’, is the first of its kind in ophthalmic world and it contains 66 chapters covering all aspects of IOLS from their evolution to IOL Power Calculation Formulas, Phaco, Microphaco Lenticular Refractive Surgery Lenses, Recent Advances and Future Prospects. • A galaxy of Top International IOL experts have shared their experiences in form of chapters for the benefit of the readers. • An exhaustive details about various IOL power calculation formulas, various lens designs, insertion techniques, complications management and recent IOL designs have been provides at a single platform for the first time in ophthalmology.

Table.TITLE: Optician+ 39 +s Guide (A Manual for Opticians)
Table.Abstract: • A basic reference book for all the dispensing opticians, counter salesmen, store incharge, etc. • Designed and developed in such a manner so as to give very basic and minimum required technical information about optics and dispensing of spectacles in a very simple language. • Priority has been given to practical requirements of the subject. • Contains almost all the aspects of dispensing spectacles which store keepers come across during their daily routine work in an optical store. • The whole text is divided into 14 chapters comprising of light, lenses, prism, selection of lenses, frames and measurements, verification of spectacles, contact lenses, eyes, troubleshooting, some useful terms, etc.
Table.authorAf1: Optometrist and Ocularist

Table.TITLE: OPTICS for Optometry Students
Table.Abstract: Introduction of this new subject of optometry in the curriculum necessitates to understand its technology and different optical instruments that are used as visual aids and for accurate measurements of normal and defective human vision what are the new dimensions to eye care techniques. This book provides an up-to-date knowledge in different phenomena relating to optics. It covers aberrometry and wavefront technology, refraction at a plane and spherical surface, chromatic aberration, optical fibre, lenses and their varieties, light, wave light and simple harmonic, motion, holography, defraction and polarization of light coherence, laser, photometry, spectroscopy, the velocity of light and its importance, viscosity and fluid motion, contact lenses, etc. Includes many recent techniques of refractive errors and surgery of the eye. Incorporate skillfully the theory and art of practice of optics and refraction. Its text is so well organized that helps to understand, retain and reproduce facts easily. Provides a detailed study on action of the eye and response of eye to light color formation of image, far and near. This book is a complete current and perfect reference to study and understand and treat disorders of eye. Most of the disorders encountered in the clinic are covered with their signs and symptoms and procedures to treat visual disorders. Intimates on silicone hydro gels disposable lenses, guides to fitting, evaluating and trouble shooting contact lenses, disposable lenses and care systems as well as on clinical topics such as bifocals.
Table.authorAf1: Retired Department of Physics Alipurduar College (University of North Bengal) West Bengal India

Which is richly augmented by a large collection of excellent photographs highlighting various aspects of surgical mgmt and outcomes. • Authored by experts of ophthalmology with cumulative experience of more than 25 years of visually rehabilitating these children.

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Clinical Diagnosis & Management of Ocular Allergy
Table.AUTHORNAME: Ashok Garg, John D Sheppard, David
Table.Abstract: • This step-by-step book furthers the understanding of ocular allergy and provides a spectrum of opinions about the methods used for diagnosis and treatment of ocular allergy the world over. • One of the unique features of this book is the assembly of the collective wisdom of physicians throughout the world who have a special interest in ocular allergy. • It is a known fact that the manifestations of allergy vary from one place to another because of environmental and genetic factors. This book is helpful in understanding the challenges faced by international colleagues and to learn which therapies have proven most effective. • In addition, this book reviews basic immunology which is a common feature of all ocular allergy and it also gives the opportunity to read about new approaches to therapy that hold promise for the future.

Table.TITLE: Essentials of Blood Banking
Table.Abstract: • This handbook deals with the basics of blood banking in brief, keeping in mind the requirements of the blood bank staff and the clinical residents. • Helps to ward off fears and nightmares in blood transfusion techniques. • Blood banking is no more confined to only cross-matching and supply of blood. Pre-transfusion testing of blood for HIV 1, HIV 2, anti-HCV, etc has become mandatory besides other tests. • HIV/AIDS awareness has shifted the focus of media on blood banks. Medicolegalities and ethical issues are very much in consideration. This book is an attempt to meet all these requirements of professionals associated with medi-care and people who run clinics and hospitals.

Table.TITLE: Laboratory Procedures in Haematology

Table.TITLE: Review of Pathology
Table.Abstract: Examinations are always an anxious and tricky moments that are cracked with hard work, complete concentration, speed and good luck. This book assists to prepare all the essential topics and revise quickly the high yield topics to ensure securing a respectable high rank. Equips the students with the knowledge that would help them streak ahead of competition and secure success. It will certainly keep students in pink times at peak points in the postgraduate entrance exams. Without overburdening to go through the textbooks again and again it provides essential and precise answers to questions being asked very frequently in the entrance exams. It provides pointwise information which can be remembered easily. It adds the necessary details so that students are able to concentrate on vital information. It incorporates the latest and new and constantly evolving knowledge on every subject which makes it a unique and very insightful book that instills confidence in the reader. This practical guide is full of valuable tips, answers to tricky questions, elaborating pointwise explanations. An excellent source of information that provides a focused help to students. Provides a fortified knowledge that would convince the examiners that you are the one who deserves to be the practicing doctor. It guides with a methodological approach to exams that would help to secure a sure success.

Table.TITLE: Infectious Diseases in Children & Newer Vaccines
Table.Abstract: • Contains 48 chapters on different infections diseases, rational antibiotic therapy and some selected new vaccines. • This book is the result of hardwork of IAP Infections diseases chapter contributed by eminent personalities in the field of paediatrics. • Incorporates problems related to some selected and important infections diseases like, tuberculosis, typhoid, malaria, kala-azar, dengue, leptospirosis and AIDS. Some infections disease related topics like, prenatal infections, neonatal sepsis, septic shock in paediatrics, pneumonia, pyrexia of unknown origin, otitis media and SARS; topics on recent outstanding problems like multidrug resistance, success and failure of polio eradication; current debatable topics on molecular diagnosis in infections diseases, and role of various non EPI and so called newer vaccines, which are flooding the present market with great hopes.

Table.TITLE: Manual of Fetal Medicine
Table.Abstract: This book mainly aims to provide information on growth and development of fetus, congenital abnormalities, maternal diseases, prenatal diagnosis, management of IUGR, twin pregnancy including studies on fetal medical, gene and surgical therapy The recent advances in prenatal diagnosis of genetic disease, fetoscopic technique and fetal transplantation are no longer considered hurdles for in-utero clinical testing A multi-disciplinary team consisting of geneticists, radiologists, pediatric surgeons, cardiologists, anesthesiologists handles fetal medical and surgical procedures. This handbook guides obstetricians to diagnose and manage fetal abnormality in-utero

Table.TITLE: Manual of Foetal Monitoring Made Easy
Table.Abstract: • Obstetrics is the only medical specialty that deals simultaneously with two individuals–the mother and her baby. The obstetricians and gynecologists endeavour to ensure optimal well being of both these individuals • This book aims to provide guidance for achieving the optimal foetal outcome using the evidence-based skills and knowledge for intrapartum and antepartum foetal monitoring • It provides a step-wise information from the physiological basis of monitoring foetal and techniques of conducting surveillance including the abdominal examination with most sophisticated and advanced techniques • Foetal monitoring including echocardiography, Doppler ultrasound, foetal scalp blood sampling and lactate analysis, pulse oxymetry, ST analysis of foetal electrocardiogram have been discussed in this book • It covers examining foetal distress

Table.TITLE: Essentials of Medical Pharmacology

This edition places emphasis on ‘evidence based medicine’ by reference to reliable interventional drug trials conducted particularly over the past two decades. Updated therapeutic guidelines from eminent professional bodies, WHO and National Health Programmes are summarised in relevant areas • Illustrations have been improved and enriched. The layout is made more attractive and user friendly.

Table.TITLE: Basic Concepts of Community Health Nursing
Table.Abstract: This book gives a sound foundation in community and public health nursing concepts along with interventions for individuals, families and community workers. Throughout the book, health promotion and disease prevention concepts are integrated into the multifaceted role of population-focused, community oriented nursing practice Emphasis is laid on to implement the concept of partnership collaboration and empowerment to attain the goal of health for all so that the most vulnerable and marginalized sections of the society along with children and women can be protected from epidemics This book explains how nursing involves a focus of four components i.e. the client, the environment, the health and the nursing. Variations in nursing care depend upon the fact whether it is provided in the acute care setting or community- based setting It covers topics such as epidemiology, personal health and hygiene, community health nursing process, family and child health services, school health services, occupational health services, etc. It also provides information on various national health problems, programmes, policies, procedures, community health management, administration, rehabilitative nursing, growth and development with statistics

Table.Abstract: • This book is a contemporary, well written, beautifully illustrated and comprehensive review of what is now a vast area of technological advancements and clinical applications of many different types of lasers in Ophthalmology. • This Mega International Book, first of its kind in the world is a dedicated hard work to provide complete information on various laser treatment options in the ophthalmic conditions. • This book contains 99 chapters written by International Masters of Laser Experts cover all parameters from Laser machine dynamics to Lasers in lens diseases; Glaucoma, Refractive Surgery, Vitreo-retinal diseases, Strabismus & Oculoplastic Reconstruction, Pediatric Refractive Surgery and Recent Advances.

Table.TITLE: Modern Medical Toxicology
Table.Abstract: • An excellent reference book on Toxicology covering general principles of toxicology, corrosives, irritant poisons, neurotoxic agents, cardiovascular drugs, asphyxiants, miscellaneous poisons and even obstetric and pediatric poisons. • A valuable source for medical and police personnel the world over. • Provides useful clinical information on poisons and poisoning to ER physicians, medical students, interns, residents, nurses, pharmacists and other health care professionals in a concise, complete and accurate manner. • Every chapter has been updated and new topics like ‘Analytical Toxicology’ and ‘Substances of Dependence and Abuse’ are added. • A concise textbook written beautifully and in lucid style using simple language

Table.TITLE: Atlas of Gastrointestinal Imaging

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Blood Transfusion Services
Table.Abstract: • This manual contains two parts- Technical and Clinical Aspects. The technical aspect includes basic procedures in transfusion medicine designed for the use of technicians and blood transfusion officers in order to try and standardize these procedures in transfusion services. The clinical aspect focuses on the rational use of blood and newer procedures in the field of blood transfusion. The text has been aimed to show how unnecessary transfusions can be reduced and right blood made available to the right patient at the right time without compromising standards of quality and safety. • Provides a compromising guide to all procedures conducted in a transfusion center form grassroots to advanced level as well as guidelines for the rational use of blood and blood products all over the world.

Table.TITLE: Emergency Medicine
Table.Abstract: • Aimed to give confidence in differential diagnosis and management of acute medical problems and is intended to complement the standard textbooks in clinical medicine. • A clear, concise and comprehensive pocket book of acute medicine in brief, informative style and easy portability. • The text summarises essential elements of care of the commonly encountered medical emergencies. • Suitable for medical students and practicing doctors who are likely to encounter clinical problems

Table.TITLE: Epidemiology for Undergraduates
Table.Abstract: • Aimed to generate interest in epidemiology among undergraduate students and enable them to learn it in a step by step and easy way. Which is achieved through breaking it down into smaller objectives. • Presentation of ideas, examples and exercises are given in reader-friendly style. • Enlightens the medical graduates on how the vast knowledge base on which medical practice function has been gathered. Also empowers them to meaningfully analyse their clinical experience as physicians and make knowledge from observations. • Enables medical students to be contributors to the universal knowledge base of medical science. • The whole subject has been divided into five modules which are further divided into small chapters comprising of learning material for one hour’s class.

Table.Abstract: • It intimates about the master key concepts of basic science and hundreds of frequently tested diseases/ disorders which are essential to know as it is important to have a full understanding of the design of the exam and the type of questions that are asked • It aims to provide the rapid assimilation for easy recall of facts in a minimal amount of reading time, as the extraneous and time consuming information have been omitted • A revision tool that strengthens the skill and knowledge to diagnose a disease. It may be read quickly for easy assimilation of the core facts that ensure to excel in exams • The text is concise and its vital focus is to let students study in a relaxed frame of mind so that they are able to concentrate on maximum retention of what is read.

Table.TITLE: Tuberculosis
Table.Abstract: This multi-authored textbook presents management of different respiratory diseases and discussion about the critical issues involved in various manifestations of the diseases frequently encountered by practising pulmonary physicians. A team of experts distinctively recognized by medical fraternity for their skills and knowledge have contributed on different aspects of the disease in the field of respiratory medicine and tuberculosis. Beginning with insights into the history and epidemiology of TB, the book deals extensively with the current understanding of the immunology and immunopathogenetic mechanisms of this disease. The study and treatment of this multisystemic disease and its different clinical manifestations have been presented by eminent scientists from epidemiology, microbiology, clinic management and tuberculosis control for a comprehensive knowledge on this subject.
Table.authorAf1: Chief, Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care and Sleep Medicine Professor and Head, Department of Medicine All India Institute of Medical Sciences New Delhi 110 029, India

Table.TITLE: Essentials of Medical Microbiology
Table.Abstract: • Teaching of Medical Microbiology is changing rapidly due to emergence of newer pathogens, newer diagnostic tools and shrinking time to accommodate all this in the curriculum. The main focus of this edition is to update various chapters and topics of current interest and delete the irrelevant matter. A lot of tables, figures and flow charts have been included for easy assimilation of the subject. • Written in a simple, straightforward, functional, easily reproducible and user-friendly style. • Clear, attractive and easy-to-make illustrations have been used in abundance to ensure better understanding of the subject. • Coloured figures have been appended to create long-lasting impressions of the appearances of the microorganisms.

Table.TITLE: Textbook of Medical Parasitology
Table.Abstract: Parasitic infections continues to account for a large part of human illness. The number of persons afflicted by parasites (malaria, pinworm, whipworm, hookworm, roundworm) run into many millions. Filoriasis, leishmaniasis and schistosomiasis remains serious public health problems. In recent years, there has been a resurgence in the study of parasitic infections. Much new knowledge has been gained making possible precise diagnosis and more effective control of parasites and the diseases they cause. This textbook attempts to present the essential information on parasites and parasitic diseases with emphasis on pathogenesis, epidemiology, diagnosis and control. Every effort has been made to incorporate recent advances in the subject. Useful to students of medicine, teachers, physicians and all others concerned with pubic health.
Table.authorAf1: Director and Professor of Microbiology and Principal, Medical College Calicut Dean, Faculty of Medicine Calicut University Emeritus Medical Scientist Indian Council of Medical Research

Table.TITLE: Textbook of Microbiology for Nursing Students

Table.TITLE: A Hysteroscopic View
Table.AUTHORNAME: ND Motashaw, Svati dave, Louis G
Table.Abstract: • Hysterscopy is based on the advances that have been made in the past, transferred with recognition of the potential pitfalls and problem. • Dysfunctional uterine bleeding (DUB), a common cause of menometrorrhagia, is now often treated by operative hysteroscopy. • One of the advantages of hysteroscopy is that it can be perfomed under general, spinal, epidural and local anaesthesia. In addition, the Bettocchi 2.9 mm optic can be introduced without any anaesthesia. • In hysteroscopy, although safety is a characteristic feature, complications can occur. A special chapter on complications will open your eyes to the rare and serious consequences that can occur on occasion, even in the best of hands.

Table.TITLE: Congenital Intrauterine Infections
Table.Abstract: A team of expert obstetricians and gynaecologists across the country have contributed from their vast experience and practical knowledge on congenital intrauterine infections. The infections are intimately related to the period of fetal organogenesis as established in research by Norman Gregg that a spectrum of neonatal and infant problems and sometimes a Sequelae developing much later have been traced back to intrauterine developments This book projects maternal infections that affect the unborn child. It includes the pregnancy outcome, problems, incidence, diagnosis, management and prevention The updates included in the book upgrade knowledge, clarify doubts, proffer the advances in perinatal medicine on this subject. It focuses on the issues that confound the obstetricians and neonatologists i.e. perinatal loss, infections morbidity and congenital anomalies

Table.TITLE: Current Concepts in Contraception and Women+ 39 +s Health
Table.Abstract: • The book has been divided into four sections. The first section deals with the demographic patterns related to family welfare. The second section deals with contraception describing the basic and current practices in intranteine contraception device, combined oral contraceptives, progesterone only pill, injectables, implants, emergency contraception, permanent methods in male and female including no scalpel vasectomy and recent advances. • The third section focuses on current health issues and various program for women. Includes chapters on national rural health mission, maternal health and women empowerment, reproductive and child health, adolescent health, bone health in women. • Incorporates guidelines regarding medical termination of pregnancy, sterilization, reproductive tract infections, prevention of parent-to-child transmission, prenatal diagnostic techniques act and assisted reproductive technology. • The fourth section deals with biostatistics describing basics of medical statistics applicable to any research methodology. It is immensely useful to everyone for the analysis of the scientific data.

Table.TITLE: Fetal Cardiology for Obstetricians
Table.Abstract: • Congenital heart diseases are the most frequent fetal anomalies and yet most of the doctors are not adequately trained to examine the fetal heart. • Ability to image the fetal heart has improved dramatically with the advent of 2D, 3D and 4D ultrasonography. • A reference manual on obstetric care contributed by well-known academicians with vast experience. • A treasure trove of information from embryology, imaging sciences and clinical medicine. • Many more babies affected by cardiac defects will find a hope of a good life through the pages of this book. • Focuses on issues frequently encountered by general obstetrician, more to his interest as in fetal heart function and high risk patient management counselling etc.

Representative color illustrations of macroscopic and microscopic pathology. • Includes some semi-schematic drawings of normal anatomy. • Useful for practicing gynecologists, residents/registrars/fellows. • Will serve as a comprehensive introduction to gynecologic pathology. • Provides enough factual knowledge to pass the Specialty Boards. • Enables to help gynecologists better understand gynecologic pathology and allow them to correlate the pathologic findings with the clinical data.

Table.Abstract: • The aim of the book is to offer a global and in-depth insight into endoscopy, Infertility and assisted reproductive techniques (ART) that spans the physiological anatomical, surgical, molecular, technical, laboratory and treatment areas, succinctly elaborating the successes and failures that various approaches have been met with. • A complete why, when, what and how guide for practitioners and students alike. • Provides a platform on which obstetricians, gynecologists, infertility specialists, researchers, scientists as well as students can share experiences, decipher the relation between infertility, ART and endoscopy, add concreteness to decision making and unentangle complex problems that often pose as dilemmas to treating clinicians.

Table.TITLE: Handbook of Adolescent Gynecology & ARSH (Adolescent Reproductive & Sexual Health)
Table.Abstract: • Adolescent Reproductive Health is very important for adolescents of the whole world. Young people start sexual activity without adequate knowledge of sexual and reproductive issues and seldom practice safe sex. They are at high risk of negative consequences like unwanted pregnancies, sexually transmitted infections and unsafe abortions. • Inspite of a legal provision against child marriage, we have a very high incidence of girls getting married before 18 years of age. Once married, they are pressurized to prove their fertility by producing a child in the very first year of marriage. Teenage pregnancy causes a high incidence of morbidity and mortality in both the mother and neonates. • This book aims at increasing awareness of ARSH issues in the professionals of all the specialties dealing with adolescents, as ARSH is closely related with high risk behaviour and mental health problems and substance abuse.

Table.TITLE: Infertility Management Made Easy
Table.Abstract: • The culmination of a kaleidoscope of disorders with endocrinological, genetic, biochemical, physiological and psychological origins infertility is recognized as perhaps one of the most debilitating and frustrating conditions that couples experience today. • Its myriad causes and consequences not only pose and serious challenge to the psyche and patience of the couple afflicted, but also to the ability and knowledge of the treating physician. • Advances in diagnosis technology such as, polymerase chain reaction (PCR), Preimplantation genetic diagnosis (PGD), blastomere biopsy, motile sperm organelle morphology evaluation (MSOME), 3-D and 4-D color. Doppler ultrasonography, in vitro fertilization-embryotransfer (IVF-ET), shared sonor oocyte program, etc. in the hands of experienced operators, have alleviated the suffering of a majority of infertile patients.

Table.TITLE: Labour Room Protocols and Policies
Table.Abstract: • Pregnancy is a time of joy and anticipation. It can also be a time of anxiety and concern. While most pregnancies and child birth are uneventful, all pregnancies are at risk. • The safe motherhood initiative of WHO recommends that skills of health workers should be improved through locally adopted guidelines and standards for the management of pregnancy and childbirth. • This booklet provides guidelines for the obstetrical problem that are commonly encountered in the casualty and labour room. • The purpose is to provide optimal service for women in labour and the key element of this approach is to reduce maternal and perinatal mortality and morbidity. • Provides guidance to postgraduates and practicing obstetrician to implement the necessary services to the patients without delay.

Table.TITLE: Laparoscopy Made Easy
Table.Abstract: • Originally laparoscopy was exclusively performed as a diagnostic procedure in the case of abdominal organ disease, mainly of the liver and spleen. • Access to abdominal cavity for any gynaecological pathology may lead to trauma to the abdominal wall which directly causes the greatest physical stress to the patients. • This book highlights basic scientific approach to understand laparoscopic surgery for gynecologists. • Incorporates not only the historical review, indication, contraindication, role of anesthesia but also focuses on various operative procedures in the uterus, ovary and tube etc.

Table.TITLE: Male Reproductive Dysfunction
Table.Abstract: • Reproduction function of a male broadly encompasses three interrelated and synergistic steps-the spermatogenesis, regulation of the male reproductive functions and performance of the male sexual act. • Fertilisation-a union normally of a single out of many a million sperms of a male with the egg or ovum of a female remains an intriguing phenomenon. • Successful union of ovum and the sperm does not guarantee normal development of the zygote. The sperms have two different constituents-one with ‘X’ and another with ‘Y’ chromosomes and chromosomal abnormalities could lead to faulty development of the unborn child in the forms of Klinefelter’s and down’s syndromes. • This book deals with the dysfunctions of the male reproductive system with emphasis on common condition

Table.TITLE: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome An Update
Table.Abstract: • Polycystic ovary syndrome is a condition dealt with clinicians in the field of infertility and reproductive medicine. The impact of the syndrome is not only restricted to women of the reproductive age but encompasses all ages from adolescence to menopause. • This book aims to provide comprehensive knowledge about the current and emerging concepts of the syndrome to the professionals in this discipline. • Extensively covers a wide range of topics ranging from history, etiology, definition and diagnosis, complex pathophysiology, definition and diagnosis, complex pathophysiology, management in different age groups and long-term sequelae. • Provides practical information and solid science which can be easily understood by a broad range of readers.

Table.Abstract: • Recent knowledge in reproductive endocrinology has paved the way for management of many endocrine disorders employing nonhormonal approach. The current trend is towards nonpharmacological approach to many endocrine disorders, due to this, the present book deals with an disorders, due to this, the present book deals with an entirely changed concept in diagnosis, evaluation and management. • Ultrasonography, by virtue of simplicity, noninvasive nature and absolute safety, has emerged as the most innovative diagnostic tool of modern obstetrician gynecologists. • Ultrasound provides clarity of diagnosis and remains strategic in decision making. This noninvasive sonographic diagnostic capability is ideally complemented by the minimally invasive operative endoscopy as the most comfortable therapeutic option. • The minimally invasive and minimally, access endoscopic operative procedure make therapeutic options quite attractive in terms of safety, comfort, quick relief, minimal hospitalization, early ambulance and early return to work.

Table.Abstract: • Gynecological problems pose a great challenge for all those who are taking care of women’s health, especially young gynecologists who have limited clinical experience. • This book is an effort to provide them the practical approach to evaluate various gynecological diseases and decide about the most appropriuate management pathway in a particular case. • Covers a broad spectrum of gynecological diseases including the common ones like vaginal discharge, DUB, PID, infertility, fibroud, genital prolapse, abortions, etc. • Chapters a amenorrhea, hirsutism and female genital tract cancers will help the readers to plan management of gynae-endocrinologica disorders and gynae-cancers. • Includes contraception related topics like missing IUCD thread and emergency contraception.

Table.TITLE: Recurrent Spontaneous Miscarriages
Table.Abstract: This book gives a thread bearing expert description about the causes of mysterious ways of behaviour of females that leads to spontaneous miscarriages. There are many facts and diverse conditions like PIH, accidental hemorrhage, IUGR and recurrent stillbirths causing this agonizing experience Psychological and immunological factors have a direct bearing on the phenomenon of disorder of recurrent spontaneous miscarriages. This book explains the ways to probe its causes with the methods of testing of antiphospolipid and color Doppler and 4-D imaging techniques to treat this disorder Provides not only the basic scientific approach for prevention and treatment of various causes of spontaneous miscarriages but also focuses on many unanswered issues with reference to this disorder The distinguished and internationally famous experts have shared their evidence-based authoritative knowledge in the field of chromosomal and anatomical causes of recurrent spontaneous miscarriages and the specialised skills to handle them

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Active Management Labor
Table.AUTHORNAME: Sudhir R Shah, Beena N Trivedi,Manish R Pandya, et
Table.Abstract: • Management of labor is the term used for all the procedures done to help the pregnant woman, once she starts labor pains and till she delivers the newborns. • Active management of labor is the need of the present era in the field of obstetrics. Undue prolong labor causes fetal, maternal and obstetricians distress. Fetal and maternal morbidity and mortality can be reduced to a great level by managing the labor in most scientific way, instead of non-active watchful expectancy. • A ready reference book presenting author’s 25 years experience on the subject of ‘active management of labor’ • Covers all aspects of labor and its effective management. • focuses on ‘How to have an easy vaginal delivery for primigravida.” • Contains 13 chapters in all consisting of the basics and standards conduction of normal labor, assisted vaginal delivery, obstetric forceps and vaccum, epidural analgesia in labor, caesarean section, active management of third stage of labor, etc.

Table.TITLE: Step by Step Caesarean Delivery
Table.Abstract: • This book interestingly teachers step-by-step caesarean section which is one of the commonest surgery performed on healthy women performing the physiological function of reproduction for society. • Provides a deep insight into all aspects of caesarean delivery right from deciding to minimizing complications. • Written in a clear and concise language discussing controversies tactfully and elaborating skills in caesarean section. • Caesarean section is a marvelous operation in which within few minutes, a crying baby is out in the world but these few minutes required years of clinical experience, repeated practice in amazingly varied situations and a real will to learn after each caesarean section. • Incorporates different surgical techniques to make caesarean section safe and satisfying experience for women, relatives and doctors.

This book fulfils many of these need as a companion to all those devoted to this profession. • Incorporates scientific information in an easy to follow language. • ‘Safe motherhood’ is not mere slogan but the aim and ultimate goal of medical fraternity. Table.TITLE: Step by Step Small Incision Cataract Surgery
Table.Abstract: • Small Incision Cataract Surgery has become the state-of-the-art surgery for mgmt of age-related cataracts across the world. It is a surgical procedure that is easy to master, safe, faster than a conventional ECCE and an effective method which delivers optimal visual results comparable to phacoemulsification with less chance of complications and no additional cost of instruments or machinery. • Most surgeons are still performing conventional extra-capsular Cataract Surgery and there is an urgent need to shift towards MS/CS which offers much better results in a shorter time. This book has been designed to provide the readers with a video-assisted instruction course on ‘how to do a manual small incision cataract surgery’, covering each step of the surgical procedure including capsulotomies, hydro procedures, nuclear delivery methods, cortical aspiration, IOL insertion and wound closure. • Each surgical detail has been explained in the text and added as a video-clip to enable the readers to actually perform the maneuver during surgery

Table.TITLE: Uveitis Text & Imaging
Table.AUTHORNAME: Amod Gupta, Vishali Gupta, Carl P Herbort, Moncef
Table.Abstract: This book highlights the current knowledge on imaging techniques, their use to support the clinical diagnosis of Uveitis entities, the detection and documentation of its complications, their management by medical and surgical interventions. This richly illustrated volume on Uveitis is written by a roster of international experts who describe the use of highly relevant imaging techniques to support clinical impressions or differentiate one Uveitis entity from other for appropriate management. The superb, high quality colour illustrations of fundus changes, fluorescein and indocyanine green angiograms, and optical coherence tomography findings show relevant details of various uveitis entities.

Table.TITLE: Atlas of Optic Nerve Head Evaluation in Glaucoma
Table.Abstract: • There has been steady evolution in diagnostic parameters of glaucoma over part few years. Never diagnostic imaging techniques are evolving and gaining popularity, but traditional techniques of detecting ONH and RNFL damage still remain gold standard for diagnosis of glaucoma. The book highlights this aspect of clinical evaluation by detailed description of the optic nerve head as captured by a digital fundus imaging system. • All the common and uncommon signs of glancoma affecting the optic nerve head have been described. This helps in understanding the multiple facets of changer in ONH and retinal nerve fiber lager (RNFL), which would ultimately help in early detection of glaucoma. • Presents in an atlas format various morphological changes of glaucomatous optic neuropathy.

Table.TITLE: Atlas of Pediatric Radiology
Table.Abstract: This comprehensive atlas featuring radiological images with diagnostic details covers all aspects of child health. It includes descriptions of 200 cases with details of new for technologies and techniques fro managing the common and important diseases encountered in pediatrics. The science and art of pediatric images is highly challenging for studying small bodies that are not fully developed. In diagnostic imaging now high resolution images of the small organ are now feasible that provide a better understanding of the diseases that affect the infants, children and adolescents. In this book the material presented for each case provides a thorough and comprehensive description of the disease entity enabling the radiologist or the clinician to develop a clear concept of the entity through the different imaging modalities that are presented. It presents a series of sections arranged to organ system Head & Neck Chest and Respiratory, Gastrointestinal Genitourinary, musculoskeletal system etc. This book furnishes the necessary data that radiologist will find useful for board certification and others like pediatricians and surgeons to treat children

Table.TITLE: Ultrasound Anatomy and Normal Appearances (A Practical Approach)
Table.Abstract: The knowledge of anatomy is an integral part of all the imaging modalities including ultrasound. Understanding the location of various organs and structures in the body, their anatomical relationship with one another and their normal ultrasonic appearances is very important in analyzing and interpreting the images. This book has been designed to explain the same with reference to the landmarks which help in locating and identifying different organs. At the outset of each chapter, the anatomy, scanning technique and normal appearance are explained in text. This followed by the ultrasound images in various planes. The images are accompanied by labeled colour diagrams and the relative probe position. This book intends to benefit each and every sonographer, in someway or the other.

Table.TITLE: Recent Advances in Surgery—11

Table.TITLE: SURGERY LONG CASES IN SHORT Clinical Notes on Surgery Third Edition
Table.Abstract: This handbook presents reviews of long cases of surgery in short for the benefit of students of MBBS final year. Provides information on the best of questions and tests with references based on the clinical cases drawn from the most important textbooks of surgery. Contains 10 long-cases giving an apt direction and guidance to write precise and correct answers on questions that are frequently asked by external examiners. The text helps to have a quick glance through the important cases, their history and relevant discussion points. It acquaints with the latest investigations, most recent classifications and current trends in management. It highlights the checklist of most-read topics about which questions are raised in clinics and examinations
Table.authorAf1: Kottayam Medical College Kerala, India

Table.TITLE: Controversies on the beginning of Human Life
Table.Abstract: • The question ‘when did human life begin? Has been challenging Philosophers, scientists, religious and political leaders since hundreds of years. • On sept. 29, 2007, the academy of medical sciences of croatia, world academy of Art and science, and the international academy of perinatal medicine sponsored a symposium on ‘facts and doubts about the beginning of Human Life’, at the Croatian medical association, Zagreb, croatia.

Table.TITLE: Donald School Textbook of Interventional Ultrasound
Table.Abstract: • Presents an up-to-date information on indications, complications and results of standard and experimental interventional procedures • Discusses in detail on interventional cardiology, fetal therapy, fetoscopy, celocentesis, fetal biopsy procedures, fetal blood sampling, fetal pleural effusion, amniocentesis, chorionic villus sampling, invasive procedures and therapies in multiple pregnancy reduction and selective termination, fetal hydrocephalus, congenital diaphragmatic hernia, twin to diaphragmatic hernia, twin to twin transfusion syndrome, etc.

Table.TITLE: Management of Urological Problems in General Practice
Table.Abstract: • Written in a simple and straightforward style, this handy book aims to give a brief and crisp account of the present day urology to the general clinicians in practice to enable them to effectively meet the routine and emergency needs of his patients and to guide them properly in the choice of treatment in specific problems. • The presentation of chapters is based on physical complains of the patients which are often encountered by the clinicians in general practice. • Structured on a step-wise pattern, the text prepares the clinicians to answer the patient’s intricate questions effectively and give appropriate advice on further clinical or surgical approaches best suited in the case. • An ideal text and reference for the clinicians in practice, residents and senior residents and booth undergraduate and postgraduate students interested in learning the art and science of basic use logy.
Table.authorAf1: Ex-Honorary Professor of Urology, Grant Medical College, Mumbai. Honorary Urologist, Jaslok Hospital and Research Centre, Mumbai and PD Hinduja National Hospital and Medical Centre, Mumbai. Consultant Urologist, 11, Aderbad, Hughes Road, Mumbai.
